snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board is said to want to highlight pilots’ evidently limited ability to manage the ubiquitous automated systems in a modern cockpit
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board hearings on deadly 2013 crash of Asiana jumbo jet in San Francisco will focus on widespread nature of related issues, including pilots' limited ability to manage automated systems in modern cockpits.
lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board is said to want to highlight pilots’ evidently limited ability to manage the ubiquitous automated systems in a modern cockpit

headline.main: Hearings on San Francisco Crash Set to Explore Broader Problems
headline.print_headline: Hearings on San Francisco Crash Set to Explore Broader Problems
